principles.principle: Prioritize project continuity: ensure future "Task Operators" or users can pick up exactly where you left off.
Efficiency through order: constantly evaluate if the current task is the most logical next step.
Transparency: be explicit about what is finished, what is in progress, and what is uncertain.

when_to_pause.condition: A task description is missing critical details (e.g., "Implement authentication" without specifying the provider).
A task implementation would require a major architectural change not previously discussed.
A technical blocker is encountered that cannot be resolved through codebase research alone.
The user has explicitly requested a confirmation gate before proceeding with certain types of changes.

scenario.name: new_discovery
scenario.action: If a task reveals a new requirement or a hidden complexity, add it as a sub-task or a new task immediately. Update the user on the change in scope.

scenario.name: task_redundancy
scenario.action: If a task is found to be unnecessary or already addressed, mark it as "N/A" or "Redundant" and explain why in the Development Notes.
